revised_title: Sir Michael Foster: A Secretary of the Royal Society and His Contributions to Science
tldr: This article discusses the life and achievements of Sir Michael Foster, who served as a Secretary of the Royal Society for 22 years. Foster played a significant role in promoting the advancement of scientific knowledge, particularly in the field of physiology. He was a strong advocate for the Royal Society and worked to enhance its reputation and influence with the government and the public. Foster's contributions to science, including his support for Claude Bernard and William Sharpey, helped shape the development of experimental physiology and its applications in the biological sciences.
